meanings.definition: To provide with a new endowment.
meanings.sent1: The generous donor decided to reendow the university with a scholarship fund.
meanings.sent2: After winning the lottery, she chose to reendow her favorite charity.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to reendow his hat with endless rabbits, but it only produced scarves.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to reendow the world with a sense of hope and possibility.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact was reendowed with mystical powers by the sorcerer's spell.

meanings.definition: To give a new endowment to.
meanings.sent1: The wealthy family decided to reendow the library with rare books.
meanings.sent2: The foundation chose to reendow the museum with a substantial grant.
meanings.sent3: The chef wanted to reendow the dish with extra flavor, so he added more spices.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to reendow the room with warmth and brightness.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes reendowed the painting with life and vibrancy.
